instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: MBA 11? - 3435 - WD. No fan spin. Orange MG without Battery. Green with the battery.
threads.message:
Hi,

Corrosion around <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>

pin 12 line broken. Fixed.

TP(1)<SIGNAL>LPCPLUS_RESET_L</SIGNAL> broken by corrosion. - fixed by running a jumper from <RESISTOR>R2081</RESISTOR> to pin 19 J6100 but something tells me that was not neccessary.


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 8.6V

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.40V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.3V


<CHIP>U7600</CHIP>

pin 2 - 0.3

pin 8 - 0.12

pin 12 - 5V

pin 17 - 1.7V

pin 16 - 2.6V



Please advice how to proceed.

Thanks!

threads.title: MBA 11? - 3435 - WD. No fan spin. Orange MG without Battery. Green with the battery.
threads.message:
Post L7630 diode mode to ground.
Do you get voltage on other big coils?

threads.title: MBA 11? - 3435 - WD. No fan spin. Orange MG without Battery. Green with the battery.
threads.message: Wouldn't be surprised if <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> damaged the CPU.

threads.title: MBA 11? - 3435 - WD. No fan spin. Orange MG without Battery. Green with the battery.
MBA 11? - 3435 - WD. No fan spin. Orange MG without Battery. Green with the battery.
threads.message:
"L7130 - 7.25v"
Disconnect battery when you work with the board on the desk.
Post exact voltage with original charger only.

L7630 diode reading looks good.
Check all traces and resistors around.
Be sure R/<CAPACITOR>C7630</CAPACITOR> are good.
If nothing strange, change <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>.

threads.title: MBA 11? - 3435 - WD. No fan spin. Orange MG without Battery. Green with the battery.
threads.message: "L7130 - 7.25v" - is with original charger connected. No battery, I swear the god!

threads.title: MBA 11? - 3435 - WD. No fan spin. Orange MG without Battery. Green with the battery.
threads.message:
Check all traces and resistors around. - check
Be sure R/<CAPACITOR>C7630</CAPACITOR> are good - check
If nothing strange, change <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> - changed. BOOM SHAKALA! works again!
Thank you very much for your help and have a great day!
